item.title: I agree with Dean Eckles that this study, “Effects of Political versus Expert Messaging on Vaccination Intentions of Trump Voters,” is too noisy to be useful. When will we reach the point where researchers can catch this sort of problem with their own designs, rather than just jumping in, gathering data, and inappropriately drawing conclusions from random patterns that happen to be “statistically significant” in the data?
item.dc:creator: Statistical Modeling, Causal Inference, and Social Science
